reference_a:
@article{pavani2017,
  title = {A network approach to affect regulation dynamics and personality trait–induced variations: {{Extraversion}} and neuroticism moderate reciprocal influences between affect and affect regulation strategies},
  shorttitle = {A network approach to affect regulation dynamics and personality trait–induced variations},
  author = {Pavani, Jean–Baptiste and Le Vigouroux, Sarah and Kop, Jean–Luc and Congard, Anne and Dauvier, Bruno},
  date = {2017-07-01},
  journaltitle = {European Journal of Personality},
  shortjournal = {Eur J Pers},
  volume = {31},
  number = {4},
  pages = {329--346},
  publisher = {SAGE Publications Ltd},
  doi = {10.1002/per.2109}
}
additional_comments: due to lagged variables in the dataset; it's not fully clear to which counter each value corresponds

features.name: reappraisal
features.coding:
I have seen what positive things a negative event can bring me.
1 = not at all
5 = a lot

features.name: distraction
features.coding:
I have diverted my attention away from my problems.
1 = not at all
5 =  a lot

features.name: suppression
features.coding:
I have tried not to show or express my emotions.
1 = not at all
5 = a lot

features.name: rumination
features.coding:
I have wasted time thinking of a past event again and again.
1 = not at all
5 = a lot

features.name: appreciation
features.coding:
I have taken time to savor a moment of the day.
1 = not at all
5 = a lot

features.name: pa
features.coding:
Mean score of positive affect items
1 = not at all
5 = a lot

Highly activated positive affect: I am full of energy and spirit.
Activated positive affect: I am feeling enthusiastic.
Neither activated nor deactivated positive affect: I am happy.
Deactivated positive affect: I am feeling both happy and calm.
Highly deactivated positive affect: My whole body is relaxed.

features.name: na
features.coding:
Mean score of negative affect items
1 = not at all
5 = a lot

Highly activated negative affect: I can feel pressure building inside.
Activated negative affect: I am feeling irritated.
Neither activated nor deactivated negative affect: I am unhappy.
Deactivated negative affect: I am feeling sad and in slow motion.
Highly deactivated negative affect: I am so bored that everything around me looks drab.
